@VicPerfecto Yeah! I also like how they have him tackle and overcome those insecurities themselves, not just monsters.
@VicPerfecto You can't help prop up and support others if you can't stand on your own two feet first
@VicPerfecto Yeah! Self-awareness and constructive criticism is good, esp. w/ help from friends.
@VicPerfecto because if he keeps crumbling at the first slight against him, then he's not pulling his weight in any friendship
@VicPerfecto But I love that they do make him examine his own insecurities and have him solve them to be a better friend
@VicPerfecto the boy is desperate for company, his entire life with his mannerisms and hobbies is shaped by it, and he's so earnest
"A-are you crying-" I just wanna see him be happy, okay!
@YerFriendMolly we're you comin outta your cage?
"Jules why do you like Misao so mu-" He's a shy boy who just wants to be strong and have friends but he's insecure and cries a lot!!!

"That's a different Ginger Man."
"So Kevin is TOTALLY gonna bang Moose right now...aw maaan they got interrupted by a body. That's just disappointing."

"Oh god! I don't like this conversation!"
This isn't a Riverdale Reaction tweet, this is just what the Moncast is like off-air
"Cheryl is a monster...I love her."
@SurelySurlyGrem what if i did...both
"Ahhh the Pussycats are back! I'm so happy..."

"'News just came in: Moose has a horsedick.'"
Note, he is just quoting the show there.
He literally sounds like a teen magazine writer occasionally mumbling his latest review out loud to himself.
"This show is terrible." "They're just having sex!" "This show is GREAT." "She TOTALLY just suggested a threesome!" "This show is EXCITING!"
Listening to a friend's reactions to Riverdale even though I'm not watching whatsoever is greeeaaaat
